intro: Sida corylifolia, commonly known as broadleaf sida, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in spikes. Sida corylifolia is typically found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
